story.en: ğŸˆ On October 7, 1916, Georgia Tech defeated Cumberland University 222-0 â€” still the most lopsided game in football history. Cumberland had already disbanded its team but was forced to play to avoid a fine, so they recruited random students. Coach John Heisman (yes, the Heisman Trophy guy) showed no mercy. The result: 222 points of glorious chaos.
